intro: Navia lopezii var. colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian Navia, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family, characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
